Title: An update for jersey is now available for openEuler-22.03-LTS-SP3

Notes.Text: An update for jersey is now available for openEuler-22.03-LTS-SP3.
Notes.Title: Summary

Notes.Text:
Jersey is the open source JAX-RS (JSR 311) production quality Reference Implementation for building RESTful Web services. %if

Security Fix(es):

Eclipse Jersey 2.28 to 2.33 and Eclipse Jersey 3.0.0 to 3.0.1 contains a local information disclosure vulnerability. This is due to the use of the File.createTempFile which creates a file inside of the system temporary directory with the permissions: -rw-r--r--. Thus the contents of this file are viewable by all other users locally on the system. As such, if the contents written is security sensitive, it can be disclosed to other local users.(CVE-2021-28168)
Notes.Title: Description

Notes.Text:
An update for jersey is now available for openEuler-22.03-LTS-SP3.

openEuler Security has rated this update as having a security impact of medium. A Common Vunlnerability Scoring System(CVSS)base score,which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVElink(s) in the References section.
Notes.Title: Topic

Vulnerabilities.Note: Eclipse Jersey 2.28 to 2.33 and Eclipse Jersey 3.0.0 to 3.0.1 contains a local information disclosure vulnerability. This is due to the use of the File.createTempFile which creates a file inside of the system temporary directory with the permissions: -rw-r--r--. Thus the contents of this file are viewable by all other users locally on the system. As such, if the contents written is security sensitive, it can be disclosed to other local users.
